resource.name: Properties receiving tax deferrals
resource.description:
Map of properties participating in the tax deferral program in Pierce County.
This program is available to citizens who are at least age 61 by December 31, 2021 or retired from regular gainful employment by reason of a disability, with an income of $45,708 or less. Exemptions must be renewed once every six years unless there is a change in status or income. Proof of income is required in addition to the information requested on the application form. Proof of disability is also required.

The exemption freezes the value of the residence as of January 1 of the initial application year, exempts all excess levies and may exempt a portion of regular levies. The Assessor-Treasurer will continue to establish the market value of the property on an annual basis. Your taxes will be calculated on the lesser of market value or frozen value.
columns_description: This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Washington Counties' (knue-r79v) the point in column 'address_1' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

resource.name: Historic Council Districts 2012
resource.description: The data represents the Pierce County Council Districts Boundaries for elections through 2021. The County Council Districts were adopted on July 12, 2011 by the Pierce County Districting Committee which is appointed by the Pierce County Council. Redistricting is done once every ten years based on census data. The 2010 census population data was used to adjust the district boundaries. Redistricting is the process of changing district boundaries so that each district is nearly equal in population. Redistricting is covered in the Washington State Legislature Chapter 29A.76 RCW. Pierce County is made up of seven council districts. One council person is elected from each district that represents at the county level.

resource.name: Election Precincts (2002-2011) (h)
resource.description: This data represents Pierce County election precincts which are comprised of voters who share the same district inventory. It is updated based on the redistricting process and is created from the 2000 Census data which was provided by the Washington State Redistricting Commission, who received the data from the U.S. Bureau of the Census.

resource.name: Stormwater Facilities - Creek and Ditch Systems
resource.description: This polygon featureclass was created as a supplemental inventory database for Pierce County owned and/or maintained stormwater facilities and/or maintained creek and ditch systems that are generally located outside of Pierce County public right-of-way and accept stormwater runoff from public infrastructure. Please read metadata for additional information (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbpubw_swfacility.html).  Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf).

resource.name: Washington Counties
resource.description: Generalized county boundary from the Census 2010 TIGER/Line files.

resource.name: Mobile Home Parks
resource.description: Mobile home park polygons throughout Pierce County. The parks are registered to tax parcel dataset and do not include individual mobile home locations. That data can be found in the "Mobile Homes" layer instead. Please read metadata (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbatr_mobilehomeparks.html) for additional information. Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use. (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf)

resource.name: Tax Parcels
resource.description: Tax parcel polygons throughout Pierce County, including condos, but not including mobile homes which can be found in the "Mobile Home" layer instead. Parcel number is the unique identifier and additional parcel attribution can be found here (https://www.co.pierce.wa.us/736/Data-Downloads). Click the link for Use Code Descriptions (https://www.co.pierce.wa.us/DocumentCenter/View/604/Use-Code-Listing?bidId=). Please read metadata (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbparc_taxparcel.html) for additional information. Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf). If you have questions or need supplemental information, please call the Assessor-Treasurer Operations Team at 253-798-3134.

resource.description: This data represents Pierce County election precincts which are comprised of voters who share the same district inventory. It is updated based on the redistricting process and is created from the 1990 Census data which was provided by the Washington State Redistricting Commission, who received the data from the U.S. Bureau of the Census.

resource.name: Landslide Hazard Areas
resource.description:
Areas in unincorporated Pierce County where suspected risk of slope instability and landslide is sufficient to require a geological assessment to determine potential for active landslide activity. resource.name: School Grounds
resource.description: School campus polygons for all campuses throughout Pierce County. Includes public and private primary and secondary schools, universities, colleges and technical schools. resource.name: Bridges - Supplemental
resource.description: This dataset includes; Railroad Bridges, Private Road Bridges, City Bridges, National Park Bridges, JBLM Bridges, Pedestrian Bridges. This feature class does not contain bridges owned or maintained by either the county or state. These feature classes are in a separate feature class.  This data should not be considered complete.  Bridges are added to this data as they are discovered while the road data is being maintained.  A bridge is added to this data if it is not found in the WADOT Bridge data or the Washington Bridge Inventory System (WBIS).  Please see metadata for additional information (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbis_bridges_supplemental.html). Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf).

resource.name: Railroads
resource.description: Polylines representing the rail network in Pierce County, not including tracks that have been abandoned. Please read metadata for additional information (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbtrans_railroads.html).  Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf).

resource.name: Encumbrances/Easements - polygons
resource.description: This polygon theme identifies all the different easements in Pierce County and also specifies the type of easement (drainage, utility, sewer etc.) The term "Encumbrance" allows for other types of rights and interest to be added in the future. Encumbrances and easements are limitations on the use of the property or land. Please read metadata (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbparc_encumbrance.html) for additional information. Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use. (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf)

resource.name: River Routes
resource.description: Polylines subset of the "Hydro-Centerlines" dataset including the major rivers and some streams with routing added so mileposts could be calculated when no physical river milepost was available (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbswm_river_routes.html). Please read metadata for additional information. Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf).

resource.name: SimCon Second Division
resource.description: "SimCon Second Division" is short for "Simultaneous Conveyance Second Division". It is part of a set of data called "Land Division - All". Please read through all of the following to fully understand what this data is. A conveyance is the transfering of legal title of property from person(s) or entity to another. A "Simultaneous Conveyance" is the transfer of multiple properties using a single survey document. Examples of this are plats, short plats, condiminiums, etc. The "Simultaneous Conveyance" data contains the current aggregated highest-level formal land divisions (plats, short plats, large lots, etc). Meaning that the most recent "Simultaneous Conveyance" type is what is represented in this data. In other words, there are no overlapping "Simultaneous Conveyances" in this data, a newer "Simultaneous Conveyance" erases what was present before at that location. There are two data sets related to the "Simultaneous Conveyance" data: "SimCon First Division" and "SimCon Second Division". "SimCon First Division" contains the next level down of polygons within the "Simultaneous Conveyance". For example a plat that contained blocks and lots would only have its blocks in this data. A plat that contained lots and no blocks would have its lots in this data. "SimCon Second Division" contains the next level down of polygons within the "SimCon First Division" data. For example a plat that contained blocks and lots would have its lots in this data.

resource.name: SimCon First Division
resource.description: "SimCon First Division" is short for "Simultaneous Conveyance First Division". It is part of a set of data called "Land Division - All". Please read through all of the following to fully understand what this data is. A conveyance is the transferring of legal title of property from person(s) or entity to another. A "Simultaneous Conveyance" is the transfer of multiple properties using a single survey document. Examples of this are plats, short plats, condominiums, etc. The "Simultaneous Conveyance" data contains the current aggregated highest-level formal land divisions (plats, short plats, large lots, etc). Meaning that the most recent "Simultaneous Conveyance" type is what is represented in this data. In other words, there are no overlapping "Simultaneous Conveyances" in this data, a newer "Simultaneous Conveyance" erases what was present before at that location. There are two data sets related to the "Simultaneous Conveyance" data: "SimCon First Division" and "SimCon Second Division". "SimCon First Division" contains the next level down of polygons within the "Simultaneous Conveyance". For example a plat that contained blocks and lots would only have its blocks in this data. A plat that contained lots and no blocks would have its lots in this data. "SimCon Second Division" contains the next level down of polygons within the "SimCon First Division" data. For example a plat that contained blocks and lots would have its lots in this data. Please read metadata (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/SimultaneousConveyance.html) for additional information. Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use. (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf). Please see provided hyperlinks for metadata and Terms of Use.

resource.name: 2020 Census Block Groups
resource.description: 2020 Census Block Group polygons (have the same first digit of their four-digit identifiers within a census tract) for all of Pierce County, realigned to Pierce County roads, parcels, hydro, railroads, power lines, etc. Population figures for race, ethnicity, median age, household size, household count, etc were downloaded from the US Census website and joined to this layer. Please read metadata for additional information (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbis_census2020_block_groups.html). Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf).

domain_metadata.value: Data is extracted from Workday using the Open Budget - BUD0879 report.

resource.name: Snow Load
resource.description: Snow load polygons measured in pounds/sq ft, intended to be a guide to the structural requirements necessary due to frost levels in unincorporated Pierce County. Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf).

resource.description: 2020 Census Tract polygons for all of Pierce County, realigned to Pierce County roads, parcels, hydro, railroads, powerlines, etc. Population figures for race, ethnicity, median age, household size, household count, etc were downloaded from the US Census website and joined to this layer. Please read metadata for additional information (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbis_census2020_tracts.html). resource.name: Crime Data (Past 12 Months)
resource.description: This data shows approximate location of select offenses within unincorporated Pierce County, and the cities of Bonney Lake, Eatonville, Edgewood, Gig Harbor, Puyallup, South Prairie, and University Place. The data is for the previous 12 months and is updated monthly. Please see full metadata (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbsd_crime_data.html) for additional information. Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf).

resource.name: Sheriff Patrol Districts
resource.description: This theme shows the Law Districts only in unincorporated Pierce County. It was created to be used by SouthSound911 (SS911) to identify and display different Law Districts and their boundaries. This feature class is registered to the SS911 CAD system, ortho-based roads and shifted annexations. Law Districts are created by dissolving Law ESZ's by District. Please read metadata (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdblesa_patrol_districts.html) for additional information. Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf). Additional SS911 Terms of Use found in the metadata.

resource.name: River Mileposts
resource.description: Point locations of ground set monuments that have been surveyed along the Carbon, Puyallup, and White rivers in Pierce County. Please read metadata for additional information (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbswm_river_mileposts.htm). Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf).

resource.name: Simultaneous Conveyance
resource.description: A conveyance is the transferring of legal title of property from person(s) or entity to another. A "Simultaneous Conveyance" is the transfer of multiple properties using a single survey document. Examples of this are plats, short plats, condominiums, etc. This data is part of a set of data called "Land Division - All". The "Simultaneous Conveyance" data contains the current aggregated highest-level formal land divisions (plats, short plats, large lots, etc). Meaning that the most recent "Simultaneous Conveyance" type is what is represented in this data. In other words, there are no overlapping "Simultaneous Conveyances" in this data, a newer "Simultaneous Conveyance" erases what was present before at that location. There are two data sets related to the "Simultaneous Conveyance" data: "SimCon First Division" and "SimCon Second Division". "SimCon First Division" contains the next level down of polygons within the "Simultaneous Conveyance". For example a plat that contained blocks and lots would only have its blocks in this data. A plat that contained lots and no blocks would have its lots in this data. "SimCon Second Division" contains the next level down of polygons within the "SimCon First Division" data. For example a plat that contained blocks and lots would have its lots in this data. Please read metadata (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/SimultaneousConveyance.html) for additional information. Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use. (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf). Please see provided hyperlinks for metadata and Terms of Use.

resource.name: Drainage - Virtual Drainlines
resource.description:
Virtual Drainlines are used to maintain network connectivity when conveyance features are absent. For example, if a stormwater pond has both inlet and outlet conveyance pipes, a virtual drainline is used to connect the inlet and outlet pipes through the pond. Virtual drainlines do not represent "real-world" features, but are used to show the flow direction and path of stormwater and maintain network connectivity in a GIS.

Please read metadata (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbpubw_swVirtualDrainLine.html) for additional information.  Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf).
